metadata.title: CVE-2017-14604 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - low
metadata.description:
GNOME Nautilus before 3.23.90 allows attackers to spoof a file type byusing the .desktop file extension, as demonstrated by an attack in which a.desktop file's Name field ends in .pdf but this file's Exec field launchesa malicious "sh -c" command. In other words, Nautilus provides no UIindication that a file actually has the potentially unsafe .desktopextension; instead, the UI only shows the .pdf extension. One (slightly)mitigating factor is that an attack requires the .desktop file to haveexecute permission. The solution is to ask the user to confirm that thefile is supposed to be treated as a .desktop file, and then remember theuser's answer in the metadata::trusted field.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14604` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-nautilus-4.0 - 1:3.26.0-0ubuntu1
libnautilus-extension4 - 1:3.26.0-0ubuntu1
nautilus - 1:3.26.0-0ubuntu1
nautilus-data - 1:3.26.0-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nautilus package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:3.26.0-0ubuntu1').
